We provide further locality information including the lowland forest of Betampona and lowland forests in Marojejy for this relatively widespread species of
Zoosphaerium
( Fig. 13A ). The gigantic females of
Z. neptunus
are currently the largest Sphaerotheriida known, reaching the size of a tennis ball or small orange when rolled up. The juveniles of this species show swarming behavior around Andasibe ( Wesener & Schütte 2010 ), a so far unique behavior for giant pill-millipedes.
